synthesis.method: Solvent was evaporated slowly under ambient temperature to afford blue-green needle-like crystals.

recovery.method: Solution of Cu-L complex (1 mM × 5 mL, pH 12.4, 0.1 M NaOH/NaOAc buffer) was collected after electrolysis and acidified with 2M HCl. Silica-supported triamine tetraacetate (30 mg, 0.9 mmol/g, 5.5equiv.) was added to remove copper(II) ions. The mixture was sonicated for 10 min. The solid was then separated by centrifugation and dissolved in methanol-d4. The methanol-d4 solution was collected and 5 µmol of mesitylene was added as an internal standard. The NMR spectrum was recorded to quantify the recovered H2L (at a recovery rate of >90%) based on integrations of proton peaks.

characterization.details: Quantification of recovered H2L based on integrations of proton peaks.

equipment.details: Used for single-crystal X-ray diffraction and powder X-ray diffraction (PXRD) patterns collection using Cu radiation.
Used to determine the metal contents in the samples.
Used for mass spectrometric analyses conducted using positive-ion electrospray ionization.

general_information.chemicals: All chemicals were used as received from various companies (Fisher, Sigma-Aldrich, etc.) without further purification.
